Two servers reused a prime when generating RSA keys. An intercepted message: ciphertext1: 681255572190231002431578320555397777608804076486686815805626740373605961368105245402493059168892723517066513043062551155619859230051706990456236988548632829963979983078007292882321750027574906097083377421434975856956273190166421775, ciphertext2: 5783282307108774766826829940350415278606824889818849153484288579134729884846925325739122410563159693805779789673934280056917270578002335238187043375978810351250334839883806792471931143011585439348827844850047921546813694461774570. Can you decrypt it by exploiting this common factor?

The flag format is flag{...}
n1=768753898624596730182192556217230030043940988639967365607103062714010556809850157135528993783813540821462778454863935337288828583433498465820277046051366982388287088983676902650379635484780738583377229486143774505419136977854307327, n2=1314697364234868930643176572502178645670516947870925844254852708535906337220761796281605804014053084135406425083135367481069822942973105673301381289858255821577524569165856035906448587179316292801768450804164582933620161504271905171, e=173894386840451802097143208820755552868235605031504905304952954657405474170870662966948649908461816363336420841616213902039991170506435748917977404988573686883098986713758197747646578014167157579293918080208045873560383179294798867

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{4dn8lwnc}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: ciphertext1: 681255572190231002431578320555397777608804076486686815805626740373605961368105245402493059168892723517066513043062551155619859230051706990456236988548632829963979983078007292882321750027574906097083377421434975856956273190166421775, ciphertext2: 5783282307108774766826829940350415278606824889818849153484288579134729884846925325739122410563159693805779789673934280056917270578002335238187043375978810351250334839883806792471931143011585439348827844850047921546813694461774570
vulnerability: common factors
hint: When two RSA moduli share a common factor, computing GCD(n1, n2) can reveal the shared prime factor.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n1=768753898624596730182192556217230030043940988639967365607103062714010556809850157135528993783813540821462778454863935337288828583433498465820277046051366982388287088983676902650379635484780738583377229486143774505419136977854307327, n2=1314697364234868930643176572502178645670516947870925844254852708535906337220761796281605804014053084135406425083135367481069822942973105673301381289858255821577524569165856035906448587179316292801768450804164582933620161504271905171, e=173894386840451802097143208820755552868235605031504905304952954657405474170870662966948649908461816363336420841616213902039991170506435748917977404988573686883098986713758197747646578014167157579293918080208045873560383179294798867
extra_info: p=19877046992798579417575410145071225491718788629680524634607894781502261917753036716805770516007467503884808879818161, q=38675458125299747510806132320141794294230496728059501710631234719668454645667722674446599417803017860550441777068207, r=33993065058868765345933694696688842260675289027176347775871277338455593591992593412245422923205860579927439793538653, φ(n1)=768753898624596730182192556217230030043940988639967365607103062714010556809850157135528993783813540821462778454863876784783710485106570084277811833031581033102929348957331663520878464768217317823985977116209964020054701727197420960, φ(n2)=1314697364234868930643176572502178645670516947870925844254852708535906337220761796281605804014053084135406425083135294812546638774460248933474364459221700915791769333316369533394390463131078632485681758781823574055179683622701298312
